basics.name: Yongin Choi
basics.label: Computational scientist
basics.summary: I am a computational scientist specializing in machine learning applications to biology

work.name: University of California, Davis
highlights: Deciphering mechanism of gene regulation across biological scales through interpretable machine learning.
Identifying set of genes driving cellular heterogeneity through interpretable dimensionality reduction method
Modeling mechanisms of epigenetic regulation of gene transcription with sequence-based large language model (LLM)
Multi-disciplinary collaborations for holistic study of gene regulation (transcriptional dynamics and cell-to-cell interactions)

work.name: Altius Institute of Biomedical Sciences
highlights: Built representation model for multi-modal and multi-scale representation of the whole human genome for navigation, narration, and similarity search for integration into next-generation genome browser
Designed sequence-based model for annotating regulatory elements from FIBER-seq data

work.name: Asimov
highlights: Developed protein prediction model based on state-of-art protein language model that outperformed off-the-shelf models on multiple public protein datasets.
Implemented web-scraping pipeline for large metadata for genes from public databases

publications.name: siVAE: interpretable deep generative models for single-cell transcriptomes

awards.title: Nobel Prize in Physics
awards.summary: The Nobel Prizes are five separate prizes that, according to Alfred Nobel's will of 1895, are awarded to 'those who, during the preceding year, have conferred the greatest benefit to humankind.'

projects.name: Quantum Computing
projects.summary: Quantum computing is the use of quantum-mechanical phenomena such as superposition and entanglement to perform computation. Computers that perform quantum computations are known as quantum computers.
